title: Has the iPhone been the biggest rip off of the last decade? - Quora

response.answer_text: Q: Has the iPhone been the biggest rip off of the last decade? A: No In fact the Apple iPhone has been one of the great advancements of the past few decadesApple has delivered a device that billions of people can use to stay in touch, get help, access the internet, learn and so much moreThose folks would have nothing of the sort before AppleThat was called the “Digital Divide” and Apple bridged that divide and made 21st Century technology available to people who would not otherwise be able to access all those resourcesApple has created millions of jobs that did not exist before, that generate billions of dollars in salaries for all those peopleApple is advancing the technology that all the other companies, all the Android manufacturers copy and anticipate every yearApple has been the biggest advancement to civilization in the past two decades

Questions like this are amusing, most basically because no one can force another to buy, use and like something. These purchases and ownership of Apple iPhones are not illusions, or forced. With the highest satisfaction levels reported, and with the highest retention of ownership it is clear that iPhone indeed looks to be the highest value smartphone compared to all others. Of course, nothing is perfect and some do not like the item. This is why we have choice and assortment. As well, those that find it too expensive or made other choices may try to justify their position or view through comments such as this. There are several top phones from multiple brands. Competition is safe. Some phones are very affordable. A monopoly is not evident. Viva la difference!
